Class ArmFSM

java.lang.Object
MRILib.statemachine.ArmFSM
public class ArmFSM extends Object
Finite State Machine for controlling robot arm mechanisms.

Manages different arm states (ArmState) and transitions between them. Integrates with ArmBotEasy for hardware control and can be used in both Autonomous (via DriveFSM) and TeleOp modes.

Requires calling update() in the OpMode loop to process state logic and transitions. Supports conditional actions via addConditional(Supplier, Runnable).

See Also:
  • ArmState
  • ArmBotEasy
  • DriveFSM
  • Conditional

  • Constructor Details

    • ArmFSM

      public ArmFSM(ArmBotEasy bot)
      Constructor for Autonomous usage (no gamepads needed). Initializes the FSM, loads states, and sets the default state.
      Parameters:
      bot - The ArmBotEasy instance.

    • ArmFSM

      public ArmFSM(ArmBotEasy bot, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad gpad1, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad gpad2)
      Constructor for TeleOp usage (includes gamepads). Initializes the FSM, loads states, sets the default state, and stores gamepad references.
      Parameters:
      bot - The ArmBotEasy instance.
      gpad1 - The first gamepad.
      gpad2 - The second gamepad.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Executes the start logic of the current state.

    • update

      public void update()
      Executes the update logic of the current state and checks conditionals.

    • end

      public void end()
      Executes the end logic of the current state.

    • setState

      public void setState(String name)
      Sets the current state by name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the target state (must have been initialized).
      See Also:
      • setState(ArmState)

    • setState

      public void setState(MRILib.statemachine.ArmState state)
      Sets the current state to the provided ArmState instance. Handles ending the previous state and starting the new one.
      Parameters:
      state - The target ArmState instance.

    • transition

      public void transition()
      Checks all transition conditions defined in the current state. If a condition is met, transitions to the corresponding target state. Should be called within the update() method of each ArmState.

    • addConditional

      public void addConditional(Supplier<Boolean> condition, Runnable command)
      Adds a conditional action to be checked once per loop. The command runs only once when the condition first becomes true.
      Parameters:
      condition - A Supplier that returns true when the condition is met.
      command - A Runnable containing the code to execute when the condition is met.
      See Also:
      • Conditional
      • checkConditionals()

    • checkConditionals

      public void checkConditionals()
      Checks all stored conditionals. If a condition is met, executes its command and removes it from the list so it doesn't run again. Called automatically at the beginning of the main update() method.

    • init

      private void init()
      Initializes all the arm states. New ArmState instances automatically register themselves. Define state logic (start, update, end) and transitions here.
